properties.title: Southerleigh
properties.heading: Texas Cross-cultural Cuisine and Brewery
properties.description: Named for the prevailing Gulf breeze and the Texas coast's proud sense of place, Southerleigh serves Chef Jeff Balfour's modern take on Texas' cross-cultural cuisine. Influenced by the coastal classics of Chef Balfour’s upbringing in Galveston married with the comfort of southern cuisine, Southerleigh boasts a curated, seasonally shifting menu that reflects Chef Balfour’s innovative craftsmanship. Housed in the historic Pearl brewhouse, Southerleigh brings brewing back to Pearl, offering 15 different beers on tap.

properties.title: Hotel Emma
properties.heading: Elevated Living on the River
properties.description: The Cellars is a luxury apartment community located in the heart of the historic Pearl Brewery. The Cellars offer a unique living experience with a variety of floor plans from studio, one, two, and three bedroom apartments. The Cellars are located on the banks of the San Antonio River and offer a variety of amenities including a rooftop pool, fitness center, and a resident lounge. The Cellars are located within walking distance of the Pearl Brewery, which offers a variety of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The Cellars are also located near the River Walk, the San Antonio Museum of Art, and the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts.

properties.title: Park Bar
properties.heading: Casual Wine and Beer Bar
properties.description: What culinary destination would be complete without a comfortable perch for a cold beer or a relaxing glass of wine? With an extensive wine list and wide selection of seasonal beers, Park Bar provides just that. In keeping with the food hall’s roster of innovative food concepts, the bartenders regularly create unique, seasonal cocktails using fresh ingredients and inventive flavor combinations.

properties.title: Cured
properties.heading: James Beard Award Finalist with Local Focus
properties.description: Cured is a restaurant located in the historic Pearl in San Antonio. The restaurant is known for its focus on hand-crafted cured foods, including charcuterie, pickles, and other preserved items. Chef Steve McHugh, a James Beard Award finalist, leads the kitchen, offering a menu that emphasizes local, sustainable ingredients. The restaurant's interior features a blend of rustic and modern design elements, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. Cured also offers a selection of craft cocktails, local beers, and an extensive wine list.

properties.title: Stable Hall
properties.heading: Showcasing local, regional, and national artists.
properties.description: Built in 1894, the stable was home of the brewery's fleet of draft horses and most recently it was a gathering place for San Antonio. Located in the heart of Pearl, Stable Hall is surrounded by restaurants, retail, green space, and a short jaunt to the northern reach of San Antonio's Riverwalk.
